Class ReadFile

java.lang.Object
ReadFile
public class ReadFile
extends java.lang.Object
ReadFile.class is the class that does the reading of the given text file as well as the calculations of the word occurrences This class uses two methods and one main method that process the whole calculation.
Author:
Jan

    ReadFile()

    This is the method that utilizes the two others methods in this class The important of this method is the focus of it being an arraylist as well as condensing code reading
    static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sortWordFreq​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> fileWords)
    sortWordFreq is the next method that organizes the occurrences by greatest to least by comparing each keys Once done so the hashmap will then be passed into a ArrayList.
    static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> wordCount​(java.io.File fileName, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> fileWords)
    This method takes the file and scans the file for words limited by the delimiter While the scanning is occurring the word is counted and checks if the word had repeated or not.

  • Method Details

    • fileReader

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> fileReader​(java.lang.String fileName, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> fileWords, java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> array)
      This is the method that utilizes the two others methods in this class The important of this method is the focus of it being an arraylist as well as condensing code reading
      Parameters:
      fileName - this will be inputed as string from the user selected textfile
      fileWords - filewords is a hashmap placing string as its key this will be used to record the data, order the data, and pass to the array
      array - this array will then be used and return. Array was choosen for easy handling on Filechooser.class gui components.
      Returns:
      the array will be return to the Filechooser.class once it contains the correct data

    • wordCount

      public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> wordCount​(java.io.File fileName, java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> fileWords)
      This method takes the file and scans the file for words limited by the delimiter While the scanning is occurring the word is counted and checks if the word had repeated or not.
      Parameters:
      fileName - this is textfile that will be passed through the method to be used scanned and read
      fileWords - is a hashmap that places String as the key this allows to keep track of the words that have repeated.
      Returns:
      Once the fileName has been fully scanned the return will be fileWords key and values to the main method.

    • sortWordFreq

      public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> sortWordFreq​(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.lang.Integer> fileWords)
      sortWordFreq is the next method that organizes the occurrences by greatest to least by comparing each keys Once done so the hashmap will then be passed into a ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      fileWords - this is a hashmap that contains data recorded from the wordCount method
      Returns:
      once fileWords is passed into the Arraylist the arraylist will then be returned
